page.title: 12BLEASBY C.E.PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: This school has 75 pupils aged 4+ to 11 from the villages of{Bleasby, {Hoveringham and Thurgarton.}It is housed in a 1962/72 single storey building with a flat roof and hanging tiles on a steel and breeze block frame.It has a large field in an attractive setting. Numeracy and literacy, especially the latter, are still central to the curriculum but arts and crafts,music, science,P.E. and games,drama and more are also important-in their own right and as facilitators of literacy and personal development.This last factor of individual growth is of such over- riding importance that the use of authority is kept to a minimum and an informal,family atmosphere is routine. At eleven years of age the children transfer to The Minster Comprehensive School at{Southwell.
